text:
The A’s hitting through seven games, including three straight losses, may be cause for “concern” but not “panic,” manager Bob Melvin said.

https://t.co/WU70E3xtBv

name: sfchronicle
text: The choice between starting college early and playing a final season of high school sports is one that many of California’s top high school athletes are facing. https://t.co/LlkAp9BrWh

name: sfchronicle
text: A's center fielder Ramón Laureano, who’s known for his throwing arm, said he has moved his average depth back to about 320 feet or more.  He is positioning himself deeper this season, he an adjustment aimed at increasing his range to well-hit fly balls. https://t.co/2gCxxQ2oP2

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Indoor businesses in San Mateo County have been ordered to close by the state after efforts to negotiate reprieve failed. Churches, salons, gyms, tennis courts and more must shut down indoor activities after midnight Sunday. https://t.co/rLJ8rekKiw

name: sfchronicle
text:
July was a coronavirus disaster in California.

Daily case counts in the Bay Area more than doubled, rising from 392 on average in June to 893 in July. Daily deaths rose from an average of 4.5 in June to 7.9 in July, making July the deadliest month.

https://t.co/sq4VAIO3dX

name: sfchronicle
text:
Stay updated on the latest case data during the pandemic with our Coronavirus Tracker. 

https://t.co/wfYmgD5MNe

name: sfchronicle
text:
For the first time, Giants catcher Tyler Heineman and Rangers outfielder Scott Heineman played in the same big-league game Saturday night. 

“I’d be very happy with him going 0-for-4 with four lineouts,” Tyler said of his younger brother. https://t.co/xDxusNUPyH
